text: I have a problem with uploading my js bundle due to a lexical error. It seems that "hs upload" revokes some es6 code. Can anyone confirm that?
In my case its vue3 bundled via esbuild:

```[1] [ERROR] Uploading file /Users/arnorinker/Code/HubSpot-starter/src/main.js to HubSpot-starter/main.js failed
[1] [ERROR] Error validating template.
[1] [ERROR] line 9180: Error parsing '`, `': lexical error at position 21, encountered invalid character '`', expected expression token```

<@US2SSCXL4> Please allow ES6 (ES2020) Syntax to be uploaded via hs cli.
I have opened an issue: <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-cli/issues/571>

I'm having an issue setting up my local development. When I enter a unique name to reference my account, I get the following two errors:
1.  RequestError  Error: self signed certificate in certificate chain
2. A TypeError has occurred. Cannot destructure property 'accountId' of '(intermediate value)' as it is undefined.
(edited)

I even deleted and re-created my developer account and still get the error.
Get this one as well did you find a solution?
I have a new sandbox account trying to install the boilerplate.
